newsitem.title: USA: Pfizer Inc defends accuracy of Visine ads.
newsitem.headline: Pfizer Inc defends accuracy of Visine ads.

text.p: Pfizer Inc on Monday defended the accuracy of its Visine television advertisements after settling a lawsuit over the ads with eye care company Bausch & Lomb Inc.
Earlier in the day, Bausch & Lomb said Pfizer has admitted no wrongdoing,but had agreed not to air its Visine commercial as part of a settlement to a June 4 filing.
In its lawsuit, Bausche & Lomb charged Pfizer misrepresented its Visine products as the best over-the-counter comprehensive allergy relief agents for the eye.

Pfizer spokesman Bob Fauteux said the Visine advertisements contained accurate information, and the pharmaceutical company had settled the lawsuit with Bausch & Lomb "solely to avoid the costs and inconvenience of potentially lengthy litigation."
Fauteux added that the commercial was taken off the air as originally scheduled, in mid-June.
